content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features of unknown primary

Staging:	T4bNxM1 with liver and lung metastases

Biomarkers:	Chromogranin A 450 ng/mL (elevated)
	NSE 35 ng/mL (elevated)

MDT Discussion:	Case presented at NET MDT 15 April 2024

Radiology review confirms stable appearances of liver metastases (largest lesion segment 7 measuring 4.2cm unchanged from January 2024) and stable pulmonary nodules (largest 8mm right lower lobe). No new sites of disease. Previous octreotide scan from February 2024 showed high uptake in liver lesions.

Pathology review of liver biopsy confirms moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features. Ki67 15%. Synaptophysin and chromogranin positive.

MDT Recommendations:	1. Continue current Lanreotide 120mg q4weekly given stable disease
		2. Maintain current dose without escalation
		3. Next imaging in 3 months with CT chest/abdomen/pelvis
		4. Monthly chromogranin A monitoring to continue
		5. Re-discuss at MDT if evidence of progression

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features, Ki67 15%, Synaptophysin and chromogranin positive

cancer_timeline.value: Octreotide scan shows high uptake in liver lesions
CT shows stable liver metastases (largest 4.2cm segment 7) and stable pulmonary nodules (largest 8mm right lower lobe)
Liver biopsy confirms moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features, Ki67 15%

status_updates.value: Metastatic neuroendocrine tumor of unknown primary with liver and lung involvement. Disease remains stable on Lanreotide therapy.
Stable disease on imaging with unchanged liver and lung metastases
Continue Lanreotide 120mg q4weekly at current dose
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 3 months with monthly chromogranin A monitoring
Re-discuss at MDT if evidence of progression
